page.title: 19BMX riding in W.Loughborough
page.content: BMX riding is a bike sport. The bicycles have a strong, light frame and knobbly tyres. For BMX riding we wear special equipment.The gloves are made of wool and plastic or leather.We also use{helmets}which are made of plastic,fibre glass and foam. The BMX suits are padded on the shins and knees and somtimes on the hips.The top is padded from the shoulder downwards. We ride our bikes on{Shepherd's Hill because there isn't a track in Lough., but they will be making one soon. Freestyle BMX riding involves tricks on ramps and quarter pipes. BMX is cheaper, more exciting and safer than motor bike riding. The{Disused Railway has a new gravel surface and many children use this track for riding their BMX bikes on. Many mums also use the track, to take their children to and from{Booth Wood}primary school.
